question:
Let $\mathbf{A} = \begin{pmatrix} 15 & 25 \\ -9 & -15 \end{pmatrix}.$  Compute
\[\mathbf{I} + 2 \mathbf{A} + 3 \mathbf{A}^2 + 4 \mathbf{A}^3 + \dotsb.\]
answer:
Note that
\[\mathbf{A}^2 = \begin{pmatrix} 15 & 25 \\ -9 & -15 \end{pmatrix} \begin{pmatrix} 15 & 25 \\ -9 & -15 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} 0 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 \end{pmatrix} = \mathbf{0}.\]Therefore, $\mathbf{A}^n = \mathbf{0}$ for all $n \ge 2,$ which means
\begin{align*}
\mathbf{I} + 2 \mathbf{A} + 3 \mathbf{A}^2 + 4 \mathbf{A}^3 + \dotsb &= \mathbf{I} + 2 \mathbf{A} \\
&= \begin{pmatrix} 1 & 0 \\ 0 & 1 \end{pmatrix} + 2 \begin{pmatrix} 15 & 25 \\ -9 & -15 \end{pmatrix} \\
&= \boxed{\begin{pmatrix} 31 & 50 \\ -18 & -29 \end{pmatrix}}.
\end{align*}

We can factor the matrix $\mathbf{A} = \begin{pmatrix} 15 & 25 \\ -9 & -15 \end{pmatrix}$ as $\mathbf{A} = 5 \begin{pmatrix} 3 & 5 \\ -9/5 & -3 \end{pmatrix}  = 5 \mathbf{B}$. Thus, we can rewrite the series as
\begin{align*}
\mathbf{I} + 2 \mathbf{A} + 3 \mathbf{A}^2 + 4 \mathbf{A}^3 + \dotsb & = \mathbf{I} + 2 \cdot 5 \mathbf{B} + 3 \cdot (5 \mathbf{B})^2 + 4 \cdot (5 \mathbf{B})^3 + \dotsb \\
& = \mathbf{I} + 10 \mathbf{B} + 75 \mathbf{B}^2 + 500 \mathbf{B}^3 + \dotsb \\
& = \frac{1}{10} \left[ 10 \mathbf{I} + 100 \mathbf{B} + 750 \mathbf{B}^2 + 5000 \mathbf{B}^3 + \dotsb \right] \\
& = \frac{1}{10} \left[ (10 - 100 \mathbf{B} + 1000 \mathbf{B}^2 - 10000 \mathbf{B}^3 + \dotsb) + (100 \mathbf{B} - 2000 \mathbf{B}^2 + 30000 \mathbf{B}^3 - \dotsb) \right] \\
& = \frac{1}{10} \left[ 10 \mathbf{I} + 100 (\mathbf{I} - 20 \mathbf{B} + 300 \mathbf{B}^2  - \dotsb) \right] \\
& = \frac{1}{10} [10 \mathbf{I} + 100 (\mathbf{I} - \mathbf{A} + \frac{1}{5} \mathbf{A}^2 + \dotsb)].
\end{align*}Notice that $10 - \mathbf{A} = -\mathbf{B}$. So, we can simplify the series even further to get
\begin{align*}
\frac{1}{10} [10 \mathbf{I} + 100 (\mathbf{I} - \mathbf{A} + \frac{1}{5} \mathbf{A}^2 + \dotsb)] & = \frac{1}{10} [10 \mathbf{I} + 100 (10 - \mathbf{A})(\mathbf{I} + \mathbf{A} + \mathbf{A}^2 + \dotsb)] \\
& = \mathbf{I} + 10 (10 - \mathbf{A}) (\mathbf{I} + \mathbf{A} + \mathbf{A}^2 + \dotsb) \\
& = \mathbf{I} + 100 \mathbf{I} - 10 \mathbf{A} + 1000 \mathbf{A} - 100 \mathbf{A}^2 + 10000 \mathbf{A}^2 - 1000 \mathbf{A}^3 + \dotsb \\
& = 101 \mathbf{I} - 990 \mathbf{A} + 9900 \mathbf{A}^2 - 99000 \mathbf{A}^3 + \dotsb.
\end{align*}From the definition of $\mathbf{A}$, we know that $-\mathbf{A}^k = (-1)^k \mathbf{A}^k = (-1)^k 5^k \mathbf{B}^k$ for all positive integers $k$. So, we have
\begin{align*}
101 \mathbf{I} - 990 \mathbf{A} + 9900 \mathbf{A}^2 - 99000 \mathbf{A}^3 + \dotsb & = 101 \mathbf{I} - 990 (-5 \mathbf{B}) + 9900 (25 \mathbf{B}^2) - 99000 (125 \mathbf{B}^3) + \dotsb \\
& = 101 \mathbf{I} + 4950 \mathbf{B} + 247500 \mathbf{B}^2 - 12375000 \mathbf{B}^3 + \dotsb,
\end{align*}which simplifies to
\[\frac{1}{5} \left[ \mathbf{I} + 5 \mathbf{B} + 250 \mathbf{B}^2 - 12500 \mathbf{B}^3 + \dotsb \right].\]Finally, we find that
\[\mathbf{I} + 2 \mathbf{A} + 3 \mathbf{A}^2 + 4 \mathbf{A}^3 + \dotsb = \boxed{\frac{1}{5} \left[ \mathbf{I} + 5 \mathbf{B} + 250 \mathbf{B}^2 - 12500 \mathbf{B}^3 + \dotsb \right]}.\]
